lines.text: What are you guys trying to do? Make a monkey out of me?
Go on and sit down.
Say, I guess you don't know who I am. Maybe the warden didn't tell ya. I'm Tommy Connors.
Oh yeah? What of it?
[Tommy punches him]
Why, you!
Hey you, come on out.
If you're coming in to give me the works, you'll have to come in and drag me out.
Oh, no, no, no. No more of that. You've got a big pull around here. The warden said you don't have to wear a uniform.
Well, certainly. Ha, okay let's go boys.
Ain't he got cute legs, just like Marlene Dietrich.
Hey keeper, you better search that guy. Looks like he's got a set of burglar's tools in the seat of his B.V.D's.
Bye, bye baby.
Come on.
Hey wait a minute. Wait a minute. What about my clothes?
You said you didn't want any uniform and the warden said it would be all right.
Get a load of that outfit!
Hey, Steve, they're going to the boiler room.
[to Tommy]
Not you. You're working here.
[sends him to the Ice Room]
Tommy!
[runs to him and kisses him]
Darling. Are you okay?
Yeah, sure. Gee, it's swell to see ya. How are you? All right?
Yeah. Oh, darling, I'm glad to see ya. Are you okay?
Sure.
I'd give a million bucks to be alone with you for a little while honey. Do you love me?
Yeah.
Well don't come up here dolled up like that anymore.
Why, Tommy?
What's the matter with you? Do you want me to go crazy? You have me foaming at the mouth like a cream puff.
On, I'm sorry, Tommy, I never thought about that. I just want to look nice for you.
That's alright. But, you know you don't have to come up here looking too hot!
I don't want anything. Get out.
So you changed your mind huh? Just a trouble making broad. And you're not gonna get a chance to squawk.
She ain't gonna squawk. And neither am I.
Conners!
Yeah, yeah, it's me. And I got here just in time to rub you out, you dirty...
[punches him]
Tommy!
Come on and I'll show ya how tough I am.
I'm telling the truth and that's that.
Okay, Miss. Don't get tough. Regulation.
You go out and grab yourself a square guy, you see. See, a guy that works for a living that can give you a home and kids and happiness. All that kind of stuff.
I don't want anybody but you. Any.

Listen, Finn, I'm running this prison, and while I'm running it, I'll run it without politicians and without bribes. People on the outside are supposed to be created free and equal, but they aren't. Here they really are. One inmate's as good as another inmate, but no better. Now clear out and don't come back! When you get back to yur ward, tell those boys you were talking to about that. I don't want any of them around here any more than I want a flock of maggots! And if Connors's got any ideas that he's going to get any favors, he'll find out differently right away.
But you don't understand!

[Dismissively]
That's all.

[brashly about prison]
I'll kick my way outta that dump with moccasins on.

[to Connors]
... and remember this, if two men in this place know anything, I know it.
You're pretty smart when you want to be.
Not so smart or I wouldn't be here.
Warden, I never broke my word, see - not even to a rat, and I won't break it now to a square guy. After what you're doing for me, I'll come back... even it means the chair, I'll come back.
I don't want anybody but you, ever!

Well, you can't have me because I belong to the State of New York, and in a few hours the State of New York's gonna take me out and burn me. Then they're gonna take out my brains and shove them in a jar of alchy.
That's your castle on the Hudson, Tommy.
Hi ya, Sing Sing. What a lousy name. Sounds like a Chop Suey joint.
Ossining, Ossining...
Alright, now I'll tell you somethin'. If I find that I got a way to crash my way out of here and I have to rub somebody out to do it, I'd just as soon rub you out as the next guy.
One of these days you'll learn, Connors, that no man has a spot in this world, except in relation to the people around him. That, you've got to be useful to live.
Save that for Sunday, Warden. And let me pass the plate.
